title: High Multilateral Debt Service
description: In 2023, Yemen's multilateral debt service accounted for 100% of its public and publicly guaranteed debt service, indicating a significant financial burden.

title: Rapid Growth in Government Expenditure
description: Yemen experienced a 47.24% growth in general government final consumption expenditure in 2018, reflecting a substantial increase in government spending.

title: Exceptional Growth in Capital Formation
description: In 2018, Yemen's gross fixed capital formation grew by an impressive 181.82%, indicating a significant increase in investment activities.

title: High Prevalence of Anemia Among Women
description: As of 2019, 61.5% of women of reproductive age in Yemen were affected by anemia, highlighting a critical public health issue.

title: Severe Anemia in Children
description: In 2019, 79.5% of children aged 6-59 months in Yemen suffered from anemia, indicating a severe nutritional deficiency.

title: High Injury-Related Mortality
description: In 2019, injuries accounted for 19.49% of total deaths in Yemen, pointing to significant safety and health challenges.

title: Widespread Underweight in Children
description: By 2022, 40.7% of children under five in Yemen were underweight, indicating widespread malnutrition.

title: Comprehensive Trade Binding Coverage
description: In 2017, Yemen achieved 100% binding coverage for all products, ensuring stable trade agreements and tariffs.

title: Dominance of Food Exports
description: In 2019, food exports constituted 99.29% of Yemen's merchandise exports, underscoring the country's reliance on the food sector for trade.

title: Low Energy Consumption Per Capita
description: In 2022, Yemen's energy use was only 68.95 kg of oil equivalent per capita, indicating one of the lowest energy consumption rates globally.

title: Minimal Financial Inclusion Among Young Adults
description: In 2022, only 5.01% of young adults in Yemen had an account at a financial institution or with a mobile-money-service provider, highlighting limited financial inclusion.

title: Low Government Effectiveness
description: Yemen ranked in the lowest percentile for government effectiveness in 2023, with a percentile rank of 0.47, indicating significant governance challenges.

title: Poor Budgetary and Financial Management
description: Yemen received a rating of 1 in the CPIA quality of budgetary and financial management in 2023, the lowest possible score, reflecting severe fiscal management issues.

title: Gender Inequality in Governance
description: In 2020, women held only 0.33% of seats in Yemen's national parliament, indicating significant gender disparity in political representation.

title: Limited Female Labor Force Participation
description: In 2024, only 5.10% of the female population aged 15-64 in Yemen participated in the labor force, highlighting gender disparities in employment.

title: Low Merchandise Exports to High-Income Economies
description: In 2023, only 0.12% of Yemen's merchandise exports were directed to high-income economies, indicating limited trade with wealthier nations.

title: Challenges in Arranging Competitively Priced Shipments
description: Yemen scored 1.7 on the Logistics Performance Index for ease of arranging competitively priced shipments in 2022, reflecting logistical challenges.
